accessDenied.description: You don't have permission to view application details

chart.title: Deployment Health
chart.description: Overview of your deployment success rate and distribution
chart.noDataDescription: Deploy your application to see health metrics

latestDeployment.title: Latest Deployment
latestDeployment.noDeploymentDescription: Deploy your application to see deployment details here

containerStats.title: Container Stats
containerStats.noContainer: No deployed container available. Deploy your application to see container stats.

healthCheck.title: Health Check
healthCheck.notConfigured: Health check is not configured for this application.
healthCheck.description: Configure health check settings for your application
healthCheck.historyDescription: Response time and health status over time

accessDenied.title: Access Denied
accessDenied.description: You don't have permission to view self-hosted applications

port.label: Port
port.description: Port on which your application will be available

basePath.label: Build Base Path
basePath.description: Subdirectory path within your repository where the application code is located. Used for monorepo setups. Leave as '/' for single-app repositories. This sets the Docker build context.
basePath.helperText: For monorepos, specify the subdirectory (e.g., 'apps/frontend'). The Docker build will use this directory as the build context.

dockerfilePath.label: Dockerfile Path
dockerfilePath.description: Path to your Dockerfile relative to the build base path. Default is 'Dockerfile' in the base path directory.
dockerfilePath.helperText: If your Dockerfile is in the base path root, use 'Dockerfile'. If it's in a subdirectory, specify the relative path (e.g., 'docker/Dockerfile.prod').

environmentVariables.label: Environment Variables
environmentVariables.description: Type KEY=VALUE and press Enter to add

buildVariables.label: Build Variables
buildVariables.description: Type KEY=VALUE and press Enter to add

branch.label: Branch
branch.description: Branch from where you want to deploy

domain.label: Domain
domain.description: Domain on which your application is available

buildPack.label: Build Pack
buildPack.description: Build pack used for the application

healthCheckEndpoint.description: The endpoint path to check for health

healthCheckMethod.description: HTTP method used for health check

healthCheckInterval.description: How often to check health (in seconds)

duplicate.validation: Please fill in all required fields

dialog.title: Duplicate Project
dialog.description: Create a copy of this project with a different environment. All configurations will be copied.
dialog.environmentHint: Only environments not already used in this project family are available
dialog.domainHint: Enter the domain for the new project

restart.permissionError: You do not have permission to restart applications

dialog.title: Delete {name}
dialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete {name}? This action cannot be undone.

delete.permissionError: You do not have permission to delete applications

redeploy.permissionError: You do not have permission to redeploy applications

accessDenied.title: Access Denied
accessDenied.description: You don't have permission to deploy new applications

environment.label: Environment
environment.description: Environments helps you deploy to different spaces

basePath.label: Build Base Path
basePath.description: Subdirectory path within your repository where the application code is located. Used for monorepo setups. Leave as '/' for single-app repositories. This sets the Docker build context.
basePath.helperText: For monorepos, specify the subdirectory (e.g., 'apps/frontend'). The Docker build will use this directory as the build context.

dockerfilePath.label: Dockerfile Path
dockerfilePath.description: Path to your Dockerfile relative to the build base path. Default is 'Dockerfile' in the base path directory.
dockerfilePath.helperText: If your Dockerfile is in the base path root, use 'Dockerfile'. If it's in a subdirectory, specify the relative path (e.g., 'docker/Dockerfile.prod').

applicationName.minLength: Application name must be at least 3 characters.
applicationName.invalidFormat: Application name must be a valid name.

environment.invalidValue: Environment name must be production, staging, or development.

branch.minLength: Branch name must be at least 3 characters.
branch.invalidFormat: Branch name must be a valid name.

domain.minLength: Domain name must be at least 3 characters long.
domain.invalidFormat: Please enter a valid domain name (e.g., example.com).
domain.notAllowed: This domain is not allowed. You can add it in the Settings > Domains section to make it available.

repository.minLength: Repository name must be at least 3 characters.
repository.invalidFormat: Repository name must be a valid name.

buildPack.invalidValue: Build pack must be Dockerfile, DockerCompose, or Static.

githubInstaller.title: Install GitHub App
githubInstaller.description: Let's connect to the app we just created
githubInstaller.terms: By connecting, you agree to our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy.

welcome.title: Connect Your GitHub Account
welcome.description: Create a GitHub App to deploy applications directly from your repositories. This setup takes just a few minutes.

secure.title: GitHub App Manifest
secure.description: We'll create a GitHub App using the manifest flow. Your credentials are securely managed through GitHub's app system.

automated.title: Automated Deployments
automated.description: Automatically deploy your applications when you push code to your repositories.

repositories.title: Access Your Repositories
repositories.description: Select and deploy from any of your GitHub repositories with just a few clicks.

connectorSettings.title: GitHub Connector Settings
connectorSettings.description: Manage your GitHub connectors, switch between them, or add new ones
connectorSettings.noConnectors: No GitHub connectors found. Please create one to get started.

currentConnector.title: Current Connector
currentConnector.description: If any repository is missing or you want to add more repositories, click the link below to manage your GitHub installation settings.

error.lastConnector: Cannot delete the last connector. Please add another connector first.

dialog.title: Delete Connector
dialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete {name}? This action cannot be undone.

reset.label: Reset
reset.info: Opening GitHub installation settings. Please reconfigure the installation there.
reset.error: Unable to open GitHub settings. Installation ID not found.

create.title: Repository
create.description: Configure how you want to deploy your application

accessDenied.description: You don't have permission to create self-host applications

domain.label: Domain
domain.helper: The URL where your app will be accessible

toast.draftSaved: Project saved as draft. You can deploy it later.

envEditor.pasteHint: Paste multiple lines from .env file to bulk import

pastePreview.title: Import Variables
pastePreview.description: Review and select which variables to import. You can mark sensitive values as secrets.
